channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: Ice shelf collapses in previously stable East Antarctica. https://t.co/s3NZt9K4l0
@RoamResearch It's weird that @conaw has me blocked. I imagine it must be a mistake? ;-)
1995: We Make Shitty Software. https://t.co/HHyRsTY4H7
Wordle 279 3/6 üü®üü©‚¨ú‚¨ú‚¨ú ‚¨úüü®‚¨úüü®‚¨ú üü©üü©üü©üü©üü©
I hope the Knicks bring back Derrick Rose next season. https://t.co/Cc2PthdjdQ
Are Supreme Court justices above the law. Can they be arrested and prosecuted, convicted, punished? https://t.co/oiupCtXQGc

When I finish a programming session, the top note in my outline is always how I'm going to start the next session. Otherwise I get the "staring at a blank sheet of paper" thing. My judgement on the next thing is much better at the end than at the beginning of a session.

@berzerkeley it's a big thing. we think other people are responsible because we were infants once, and our basic ideas were formed then, and at that time our happiness was in fact in the hands of someone else.
Tesla fired an employee after he posted driverless tech reviews on YouTube. https://t.co/k5klKkwkZ0

When we got to the bottom of why people hated us for hosting their blogs for free it was this. They thought that if they did a blog, people would listen to them. They thought we were promising that (we weren't we had no illusions about that).
Another thing to learn from. When you ship a new product, think carefully about what features you want to implement first, so early users get an idea where the product is going. What its "vector" is long-term, because as we know, software is a process, not a thing.
The idea that software is a process was the big idea in "We Make Shitty Software" in September 1995.
Here's a screen shot of the relevant portion.
https://t.co/HHyRsTXwRz https://t.co/ZaeBwQaaGA
I got a lot of shit from devs who said they don't make shitty software, but in fact, they do. All devs do. Those that don't know they do don't know to set up a process that accounts for the shittiness of their software.
A corollary -- Some of the shittiest software is made by devs who think their software isn't shitty.

@AFP Wouldn't it be cool if we had a channel that could speak directly to the Russian people to tell them that many of us in the US are of Russian descent, we celebrate the culture, but we can't have you guys invading sovereign countries, and that's our main problem with Russia.

Putin must not have known how much power he had. Ukraine is small potatoes. He was the czar of one half of the political system of the US. It was a real possibility his party would control the whole govt again in 2024. A lot of times people don't know how successful they've been.
